question.title: Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extra terrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

Q.title: Will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030

P_given_Q.title: Given we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030, will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life before 2045?
P_given_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: We detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before January 1, 2030. Then, will humanity discover convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and do so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as Yes if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that we will not detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030, will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life if it is discovered before 2045?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: We will not detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before January 1, 2030. Then will humanity discover convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and do so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: This question will resolve as Yes if no exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as Yes if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.

question.title: Will we find life on Mars by 2050?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions.
If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this question will resolve as No

Q.title: Will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030

P_given_Q.title: Given that we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030, will we find life on Mars by 2050?
P_given_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: We detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before January 1, 2030. Then will we find life on Mars by 2050? This question will resolve as Yes if prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this question will resolve as No.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that we do not detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030, will we find life on Mars by 2050?
P_given_not_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: We will not detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before January 1, 2030. Then will we find life on Mars by 2050? The resolution criteria for the first question is that it resolves as Yes if no exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. The resolution criteria for the second question is that it resolves as Yes if prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) humanity discovers extraterrestrial life on Europa before 2045 and (b) unambiguous evidence of life on Mars is found before 2050?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:
(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.

Q.title: Will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030

P_given_Q.title: Given we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030, will both humanity discover extraterrestrial life on Europa before 2045 and unambiguous evidence of life on Mars be found before 2050?
P_given_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: We will detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before January 1, 2030. (b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that we will not detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030, will both of the following occur: (a) humanity discovers extraterrestrial life on Europa before 2045 and (b) unambiguous evidence of life on Mars is found before 2050?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
- We will not detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before January 1, 2030. 
Then, will both of the following occur: 
(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means. 
(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.

P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: We will not detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before January 1, 2030. Then will either of the following occur:

(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. question.title: Will US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

P_given_Q.title: Given that there will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040?
P_given_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.

Condition: The first question resolves positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy this requirement would be 2095-2099.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that there will be less than 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has not been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible, with the critical value to look for being 1.8 ˚C. 

Additionally, this question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.

question.title: Will there be a global thermonuclear war by 2070?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if there is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory
Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway

Q.title: Will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes in the event that before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur

P_given_Q.title: Given there is a major famine in North Korea before 2025, will there be a global thermonuclear war by 2070?
P_given_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. Then will there be a global thermonuclear war by 2070? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as Yes if there is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
1. Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
2. Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given there is no major famine in North Korea before 2025, will there be a global thermonuclear war by 2070?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before January 1, 2025, there are no credible reports indicating that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. Then, will there be an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true: 
1. Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
2. Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if one of the conditions for global thermonuclear war is met. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040 and (b) there be a global thermonuclear war by 2070?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:
(a) At any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.
(b) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
- Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
- Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that there will be less than 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will both of the following occur: (a) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040 and (b) there be a global thermonuclear war by 2070?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria:
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met:
(a) At any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.
(b) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
- Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
- Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
If the condition regarding global warming is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040? (b) A global thermonuclear war by 2070?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs:
(a) US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) falls below 75 years at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.
(b) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
- Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
- Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway.

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

P_given_Q.title: Given that there will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will either of the following occur: (a) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040? (b) A global thermonuclear war by 2070?
P_given_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880, according to NASA data. Then, will either of the following occur: (a) US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) falls below 75 years at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations; or (b) there is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory, or two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory?

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that there will be no at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will either of the following occur: (a) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040? (b) A global thermonuclear war by 2070?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: By January 1, 2100, there has not been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.

Then, will either of the following occur:
(a) US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) falls below 75 years at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations?
(b) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
- Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
- Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory?

Resolution criteria for P: This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has not been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.

Resolution criteria for Q: This question will resolve as Yes if either (a) or (b) occurs as defined above.

question.title: Will there be a "World War Three" before 2050?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of these conditions are true:
There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing.
At least 10 million people (civillians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.
[see edit history in the fine print]
Fine Print
PPP will may be determined from the following sources, in order of precedence:
IMF
World Bank
United Nations
CIA
[2022-03-24]: Edited to clarify that "world GDP" will be determined in PPP for condition 1 .
[2021-11-24]: Edited to clarify the time constraints.
(Edit 1/16/19 to remove third "described as WWIII" criterion.)

Q.title: Will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes in the event that before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur

P_given_Q.title: Given there will be a major famine in North Korea before 2025, will there be a "World War Three" before 2050?
P_given_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria for P:
This question will resolve as Yes in the event that before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur.

Resolution Criteria for Q:
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of these conditions are true:
1. There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing.
2. At least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given there is no major famine in North Korea before 2025, will there be a World War Three before 2050?
P_given_not_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: There will be no major famine in North Korea before January 1, 2025, meaning there are no credible reports indicating that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. Then, will there be a "World War Three" before January 1, 2050? This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of these conditions are true: 1) There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing. 2) At least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.

question.title: Will the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if the price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. This question resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

P_given_Q.title: Given that there will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
P_given_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880, according to NASA data. Then, will the price of water hit $2500 (adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD) on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC? This question resolves positively if the price of water hits $2500 by that date, negatively if it does not, and ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that there will be less than 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: By January 1, 2100, there has not been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. This means that the critical value to look for with respect to the NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. 

Then, will the price of water hit $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC? This question resolves positively if the price of water hits $2500 by that date, negatively if it does not hit $2500, and ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) a "World War Three" before 2050 and (b) the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:
(a) There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing, and at least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050.
(b) The price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. This question resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050.

Fine Print
PPP will may be determined from the following sources, in order of precedence:
IMF
World Bank
United Nations
CIA
[2022-03-24]: Edited to clarify that "world GDP" will be determined in PPP for condition 1.
[2021-11-24]: Edited to clarify the time constraints.
(Edit 1/16/19 to remove third "described as WWIII" criterion.)

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

P_given_Q.title: Given that there will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will both of the following occur: (a) a "World War Three" before 2050 and (b) the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
P_given_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. 
Then will both of the following occur: 
(a) There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing, and at least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050; and 
(b) The price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC? 
This question resolves as Yes if both conditions are met; resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date; and resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that there will be less than 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will both of the following occur: (a) a "World War Three" before 2050 and (b) the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot by 2050?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: There will be less than 2˚C of global warming by 2100, which resolves positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has not been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.

Then, will both of the following occur: 
(a) There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing, and at least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, and 
(b) the price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC? 

This question resolves as Yes if both conditions (a) and (b) are met, and resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by 2050: (a) a "World War Three" (b) the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot?
question.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs:
(a) A "World War Three" occurs before 2050. This will be true if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of these conditions are true:
- There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing.
- At least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.
PPP may be determined from the following sources, in order of precedence:
IMF, World Bank, United Nations, CIA.
(b) The price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. This question resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050.

Q.title: Will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes in the event that before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur

P_given_Q.title: Given there is a major famine in North Korea before 2025, will either of the following occur by 2050: (a) a "World War Three" (b) the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot?
P_given_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: There is a major famine in North Korea before January 1, 2025, which resolves as Yes if credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. Then will either of the following occur by 2050: (a) A "World War Three" occurs before 2050, which will be true if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of these conditions are true: There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing; At least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict. (b) The price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC, which resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given there is no major famine in North Korea before 2025, will either of the following occur by 2050: (a) a "World War Three" or (b) the price of water on the NQH20 hit $2,500 (2021 USD) per acre-foot?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before January 1, 2025, there are no credible reports indicating that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. Then, will either of the following occur by 2050:
(a) A "World War Three" occurs before 2050. This will be true if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of these conditions are true:
- There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing.
- At least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.
(b) The price of water hits $2500, adjusted for inflation to 2021 USD, on the NQH20 by 2050-01-01, 00:00 UTC. This question resolves negatively if the price of water does not hit $2500 by that date, and it resolves ambiguously if the NQH20 or a similar exchange doesn't continuously track California water prices up until 2050.
